node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.alt: This corner property in Flatbush used to be home to Nioâ€™s Trinidad Roti Shop.
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
node.content: ["$2 MILLION", "2700 Church Avenue (at Rogers Avenue)", "Brooklyn", "Built in 1895, this 4,800-square-foot, two-story building in Flatbush was delivered vacant. The upper unit was an office space, and the ground floor used to be home to a bakery.", "Buyer: 2700 Church Realty", "Seller: The Francis family", "Brokers: Erik Rodriguez of Rodriguez Commercial Realty", "$4.05 MILLION", "120 East 116th Street (between Park and Lexington Avenues)", "Manhattan", "This five-story, 9,800-square-foot building in Harlem was built around 1900. It contains eight two-bedroom apartments, all occupied, and a retail space that has been vacant since Granada International Sales, a liquor store, left in 2016.", "Buyer: Flatiron Realty Capital", "Buyer\u2019s Broker: Josh Goldflam of Highcap Group", "Seller: The Abi-Hassoun family", "Seller\u2019s Brokers: Mr. Goldflam and Jeff Weiss, also of Highcap Group", "$12 MILLION", "435 West 141st Street (between Convent Avenue and Hamilton Terrace)", "Manhattan", "This church in the Hamilton Heights Historic District of Harlem has been owned by St. Luke\u2019s Episcopal Church since it was built in 1892. Designed by Robert H. Robertson, the architect of the historic New York Savings Bank building in Chelsea, it is about six stories high. The property is being sold as a redevelopment site with 60,975 buildable square feet.", "Seller: St. Luke\u2019s Episcopal Church", "Brokers: Dwane Omar Jones, Kodi Traver and Joseph French Jr. of Marcus & Millichap"]
